author: Anonymous Mouse
title: Contract Violation in Autograder
question:
Hi, 
Can someone please clarify what contract violation means in the autograder message?
student_answer:
The part of the autograder report that says contract violation should also mention a function: that will be helpful in finding the mistake in your code.
As I understand it, when we use most functions in Racket, there are some guarantees we’re making about the data we give them - for example, that string=? has at least two parameters and that they’re both strings. If these guarantees (“contracts”) are broken, the autograder will spit out a contract violation.
The Racket documentation has some helpful information: https://docs.racket-lang.org/guide/contract-boundaries.html
The function should take in the same datatypes as the signature states.
